fields.name: AcceptWO
fields.fieldText: Work Order can only be accepted,if the WO Status is sent.

fields.name: AcceptWO_Error
fields.fieldText: Accept Work Order

fields.name: API_WO_Error_Accept
fields.fieldText: Oh no... An unexpected error has occurred. You can try this action again, but if you're unable to proceed please notify your Salesforce Administrator.

fields.name: Accept_Wo
fields.fieldText: Accept Work Order

fields.name: Accept_WorkOrder
fields.fieldText: WorkOrder is accepted.

fields.name: AcceptWo_NotSucces1
fields.fieldText: Accept Work Order

fields.name: Acorn_number_null_msg
fields.fieldText: You cannot perform this action currently. Please try again after sometime.

fields.name: Acorn_workorder_number_null
fields.fieldText: You cannot perform this action currently. Please try again after sometime.

fields.name: Cancel_S6
fields.fieldText: Cancel Work Order

fields.name: CandCHelp
fields.fieldText: You're about to cancel a case and work order and recreate them for service on {!Service_Date}. If this is correct, please press "Next". Otherwise if you need to make changes please press "Previous".

fields.name: Cancel_S3
fields.fieldText: Cancel Work Order

fields.name: Cancellation_Description_Non_Vendor
fields.fieldText: Cancellation Description

validationRule.errorMessage: Please enter at least 9 characters in the cancellation description field

fields.name: Cancellation_Reason3
fields.fieldText: Cancellation Reason

fields.name: Send_Work_Order_to_Vendor
fields.fieldText: Send Work Order to Vendor?

fields.name: Cancel_S5
fields.fieldText: Cancel Work Order

fields.name: CanceledNotification
UserRedirection
fields.fieldText: Actions cannot be taken on this work order because the work order is currently {!v_EachWorkOrder.Status}.

fields.name: Cancel_S4
fields.fieldText: Cancel Work Order

fields.name: CancellationHelp
fields.fieldText: Please select the cancellation reason from the drop down below., and document a brief description as to why the work order is being canceled.

fields.name: Cancellation_Reason_Picklist
fields.fieldText: Select Cancellation Reason

fields.name: Cancellation_Description
fields.fieldText: Cancellation Description

validationRule.errorMessage: Please provide a cancellation description longer than 9 characters

fields.name: CreateCaseHelp
fields.fieldText:
There was an error creating your new case. Please provide these details your administrator:


{!$Flow.FaultMessage}

fields.name: Cancel_S1
fields.fieldText: Cancel Work Order

fields.name: WarningNoWOHelp
fields.fieldText: You are about to cancel a work order and not issue a new work order. Please click "Next" to proceed with this action or "Previous" to change your selections.

fields.name: Dryrun_S2
fields.fieldText: Dry Run Work Order

fields.name: DryRunHelp
fields.fieldText: Please enter the Dry Run cost and price. Please note that you may need to refer to Red Notes to determine the customer's price for the dry run, or if approval is needed to bill the customer.

fields.name: Dry_Run_Cost
fields.fieldText: Dry Run Cost
fields.helpText: The cost that has been provided by the Vendor

fields.name: Dry_Run_Price
fields.fieldText: Dry Run Price
fields.helpText: The price that has been calculation based on feedback from the Customer Account Team, or derived from contractual artifacts such as the Acorn CMT.

fields.name: Dry_Run_Root_Cause
fields.fieldText: Dry Run Root Cause
fields.helpText: Select the closest approximate reason as to why this work order is being marked as a dry run

fields.name: Dry_Run_Description
fields.fieldText: Dry Run Description
fields.helpText: Please write a brief description of the issue encountered onsite by the hauler

validationRule.errorMessage: Please provide a dry run description longer than 9 characters

fields.name: NeedApprovalHelp
fields.fieldText: Need approval per Red Notes? Don't worry, we haven't changed any records yet. Simply navigate away from this page and make your selections again once you have input from the approver.

fields.name: DuplicateWarningHelp
fields.fieldText:
A duplicate work order may exist. Please review the below work orders to determine that a duplicate is not being issued. If these are not true duplicates, please confirm using the checkbox at the bottom of the screen prior to pressing "Next", or press "Previous" to change the service date.
{!v_DuplicateWorkOrders}

fields.name: Bypass_Duplicate
fields.fieldText: Ignore Duplicate

validationRule.errorMessage: Please confirm that you wish to bypass the duplicate check. Otherwise, please press "Previous" to change the service date.

fields.name: IssueGettingOneHelp
fields.fieldText:
There was an issue retrieving the work order record details associated to this case. Please provide the following error to your administrator:


{!$Flow.FaultMessage}

fields.name: CreateNewHelp
fields.fieldText: When will the new service be provided?

fields.name: Service_Date
fields.fieldText: Service Date

validationRule.errorMessage: The new service date should be today or in the future

screens.name: New_Case_Date_w_End_Date
screens.label: New Case Date w End Date

fields.name: CreateNewHelp_0
fields.fieldText:
This service will end on {!var_EndDate}. If service is needed beyond this date, the end dates will need to be removed before you can proceed.


When will the new service be provided?

fields.name: Service_Date_0
fields.fieldText: Service Date

validationRule.errorMessage: The new service date should be today or in the future, and it should not exceed the asset's end date

fields.name: WorkOrderRecreateHelp
fields.fieldText:
Does a new work order need to be created?
An example of why a new work order would be created is if the service was marked as a Dry Run because a car was blocking the container, and the customer still requires a pickup.

fields.name: Work_Order_Recreate
fields.fieldText: Work Order Recreate

fields.name: Update_Service
fields.fieldText: Update Service Date

fields.name: New_Service_Date
fields.fieldText: New Service Date

validationRule.errorMessage: The service date should not be set to a date in the past.

fields.name: Resend_Wo_Radio
fields.fieldText: Resend Work Order

fields.name: resendHelp
fields.fieldText: Your work order cannot be resent at this time. Please try to resend this work order later. If the PDF is required immediately, navigate to the Work Order record you are trying to resend and use the "Download WO PDF" function to download the PDF manually and send to the interested party.

fields.name: Update_Inelligible
fields.fieldText: Update Service Date

fields.name: IneligibleHelp
fields.fieldText: This work order cannot have it's service date updated at this time due to its current status. If you wish to update the service date, a new work order and case will need to be created.

fields.name: WO_Sucess
fields.fieldText: Update Work Order

fields.name: ServiceDateUpdateHelp
fields.fieldText: The service date has been successfully updated to {!v_EachWorkOrder.Service_Date__c}!

fields.name: Resend_Wo
fields.fieldText: Resend Work Order

fields.name: ServiceDateInPastHelp
fields.fieldText:
The Service Date of this work order, {!v_EachWorkOrder.Service_Date__c}, is in the past. It may not be necessary to resend this work order to the vendor.
Please identify below if you wish to resend this work order to the vendor.

fields.name: Resend_Back_Dated_Work_Order
fields.fieldText: Resend Back-Dated Work Order?

fields.name: SLAOverrideHelp
fields.fieldText: Please indicate below why you are overriding the customer's SLA (the date you selected is before the customer's entitled SLA date/time) and a brief description of why the SLA date is being overridden.

fields.name: SLA_Override
fields.fieldText: SLA Override

fields.name: SLA_Override_Description
fields.fieldText: SLA Override Description

validationRule.errorMessage: Please provide a description longer than 9 characters

fields.name: SuccessHelpText
fields.fieldText: Your new case has been created! The new case number is {!v_NewCaseRecord.CaseNumber}!

fields.name: Cancel_S7
fields.fieldText: Cancel Work Order

fields.name: SuccessHelp
fields.fieldText: You have successfully canceled the work order, and the case has transitioned to the appropriate status and sub-status. If you haven't notified the customer, you should proceed to do so and log the interaction using the "Log A Call" functionality in the "Feed" section of the case details.

fields.name: ServiceDateErrorHelp
fields.fieldText:
An error has occurred. You may retry this action, however the error message is below. Please provide this error message to your administrative support team.


{!$Flow.FaultMessage}

fields.name: UpdateErrorHelp
fields.fieldText:
Oh no... An unexpected error has occurred. You can try this action again, but if you're unable to proceed please notify your Salesforce Administrator with the below error:


{!$Flow.FaultMessage}

screens.description: The screen displayed when the case record is only tied to one work order
screens.name: Work_Order_Details
screens.label: Work Order Details

fields.name: WorkOrderDetails
ActionSelectorHelpText
fields.fieldText: If you need to take action on this work order, please select an action item below:

fields.name: Work_Order_Actions
fields.fieldText: Work Order Actions

screens.name: Work_Order_Dry_Run_Not_Permitted
screens.label: Work Order Dry Run Not Permitted

fields.name: DryRun_S1
fields.fieldText: Dry Run Work Order

fields.name: DryRunErrorHelp
fields.fieldText:
You cannot perform a dry run on a work order under the following conditions:
- The work order is currently canceled - The work order has a service date in the future
If one of these actions need to occur to this work order, please address them in Acorn.

fields.name: Resend_Sucess
fields.fieldText: Resend Work Order

fields.name: ResentConfirmation
fields.fieldText:
The work order was resent on {!$Flow.CurrentDateTime}!
If additional actions need to be taken, please press the "Finish" button to be taken back to the start of the Modify Work Order process.

variables.description: The variable to store the Case record
variables.name: v_CurrentCaseRecord
